** TAKES EFFECT SEPTEMBER 30, 2013 PER CHAPTER 398 OF 2010 **
The General Assembly may authorize the Board to:
borrow money for any public purpose; and
issue State bonds to evidence the debt.
An enabling act shall specify the total principal amount of the debt authorized by the enabling act.

An enabling act under this section may contain:
an additional provision for all or part of the principal of and interest on the State bonds issued under the enabling act to be paid primarily from sources of funds other than a State tax on assessable property; and
any other additional provision that is appropriate to the purpose of the enabling act and the nature of State bonds.
